content.heading: HTML Styles - CSS
paragraphs: CSS stands for Cascading Style Sheets.
CSS saves a lot of work. It can control the layout of multiple web pages all at once.
CSS = Styles and Colors, Manipulate Text, Colors, Boxes

content.heading: What is CSS?
paragraphs: Cascading Style Sheets (CSS) is used to format the layout of a webpage.
With CSS, you can control the color, font, size of text, spacing between elements, positioning, background images or colors, and much more!
Tip: The word cascading means that a style applied to a parent element will also apply to all child elements within the parent.

content.heading: Using CSS
paragraphs: CSS can be added to HTML documents in 3 ways:
1. Inline - by using the style attribute inside HTML elements.
2. Internal - by using a <style> element in the <head> section.
3. External - by using a <link> element to link to an external CSS file.

content.heading: CSS Padding
paragraphs: The CSS padding property defines space between the text and the border.

content.heading: Example

paragraphs: The CSS margin property defines space outside the border.
